oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prize money claim
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This document is part of a claim for prize money due to Henry G. Thorburn of the U.S.S. Lacawanna. Testifying to the identity of Thorburn are William A. Allen of Brooklyn, N.Y. and Jacob Lockhart of N.Y., both seamen. Allen was on the Lacawanna and Lockhart the Marblehead. The prize claim was for the taking of the blockade runner Planter, which the Lacawanna took on June 15, 1863 near Mobile. Also included is Thornburn's discharge from the U.S.S. Colorado dated February 10, 1864.
